result.execSummary:
The defendant Nicholas D Kvatek was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: Repeater], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer [Modifiers: Habitual Criminality], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Eligible for Earned Release and Challenge Incarceration Programs after serving 2 1/2 years of total confinement.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to 12CF250.

superMiscConds.notes:
Pay restitution, joint and severally.  
Court allows the state 30 days to determinate restitution and prepare a proposed order with copies to the defendant, defense counsel and the state.  If objection to amount, the restitution hearing to be requested within 30 days, otherwise deemed waived. 

25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.

**Amended to reflect that Restitution is determined to be $0.**
Pay costs at the rate of 25%.

records.addlTxt: Count 4
Count 1

Defendant Nicholas D Kvatek in court with attorney Jerod Albert Barkley. Defendant Nicholas D Kvatek in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Both cases heard: 12CF250, 14CF65

Court and both counsel have received the PSI. 
Atty Barkley states corrections. 

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant makes statements to the Court. 

BY THE COURT: 
12CF250: Sentenced 3 years Prison with 1 year Initial Confinement followed by 2 years Extended Supervision, 236 days credit, only applied one time due to being consecutive. Consecutive to 14CF65:
14CF65: Sentenced to 6 years Prison with 3 years Initial Confinement followed by 3 years Extended Supervision, consecutive to 12CF250:

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
Comply with AODA treatment and Aftercare recommendations.  He is to get treatment while in prison and be in full compliance with that treatment program.
Follow all treatment recommendations. 
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment.
Not associate with any persons consuming/possessing alcohol or controlled substances. 
Not possess/consume controlled substances unless prescribed and take only as prescribed.
Obtain all medications from one pharmacy.
Sign releases of information so the agent can monitor his treatment programs. 
Obtain and maintain fulltime employment. 
Can go to school only on a part-time basis but will be in addition to the fulltime employment. 
No contact with victims in this case except to write letter of apology to victims within 30 days and forward to agent to read and make sure it is a sincere apology before it is forwarded. 
Pay restitution: 
12CF250 - Joint and Severally to Worzella and Sons in the amount of $6,770.51.
25% of all moneys deposited into the defendants prison account shall be applied to the payment of fines, costs & restitution in this file.  If any fines, costs & restitution remain outstanding at the end of the confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining balances shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.
Restitution in 14CF65: Court allows the state 30 days to determine restitution and prepare a proposed order with copies to the defendant, defense counsel and state.  If objection to amount, restitution hearing to be requested within 30 days, otherwise deemed waived. 
10% restitution surcharge is ordered. 
Restitution must go to victim FIRST before any surcharge is collected by any government agency.  If taken, government agency will be subject to contempt of Court. 
Pay costs.  In 14CF65 there is the mandatory DNA surcharge on each count.  In 12CF250, Court does not order the DNA surcharge. 

14CF65 Count 4 - 
6 months jail, concurrent with 12CF250 and 14CF65.
Pay costs including the DNA surcharge.

Eligible for programs after 2 years 6 months total confinement.
Sentencing hearing on October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

$5,000 cash bond on each file: 14GF41 and 12CF250: Comply with conditions of bond in 12CF250.  No contact with Everything from A - Z store and Rebecca Bula.  Defendant to contact the Public Defender.
July 21, 2014:  Bond will be amended to delete the no contact with Ms. Bula. /s/TTF

Defendant Nicholas D Kvatek in court with attorney Jerod Albert Barkley. Defendant Nicholas D Kvatek in custody. Cass Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard at this time are 12CF-250 and 14CF-65.

11:25 AM Court calls cases.
Atty Cousins states appearances.

Matters are set for a plea today.

There is an agreement.
State files an amended information in 14CF-65.
Count 4 is added.

14CF-65:
Defendant will plead to Counts 1 and 4. Counts 2 and 3 would be dismissed and read in.
Defense is free to argue.
12CF-250:
Defendant will plead to single count, consecutive to any sentence imposed. Defense is free to argue.
Restitution would be included in both files.

Atty Barkley concurs.
Atty Barkley states he had received a copy of the amended information in 14CF-65.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
NO CONTEST 12CF-250.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 1 14CF-65.
Defendant enters a plea of: NO CONTEST Count 4 14CF-65.

Court questions Defendant regarding pleas.
Defendant is incarcerated at the county jail at this time.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Barkley for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Both attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charges.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charges.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
12CF-250: contrary to the statutes sections stated therein 
14CF-65: Count 1 contrary to the statutes sections stated therein, amended information
14CF-65: Count 2 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-65: Count 3 Dismissed and Read In
14CF-65: Count 4 contrary to the statutes sections stated therein, amended information

Court informs Defendant regarding the statute of party to the crime charge. Defendant has no questions.

BY THE COURT:
Court will order a PSI.
PSI to be completed by September 19th. Copies forwarded to counsel so they can prepare their sentencing arguments.

Defendant has had a PSI done before for forgery charge.

Atty Barkley addresses the Court with regards to bond, requests to lift contact of Rebecca Bula.

BY THE COURT:
14CF-65: Bond will be amended to delete the no contact with Ms. Bula.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on July 21, 2014 at 11:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on June 9, 2014 at 09:00 am.
